author: m.kalinin
content: I am asking about a bit different case: a block is invalid but it contains attestations to other blocks that are valid and have been applied to the fork choice

author: potuz
content: Ah, in this case I guess it will be implementation dependent. We will not process those attestations in forkchoice afair

author: m.kalinin
content: I see. Thanks for clarification! This is important for the fork choice test suite we're currently working on. It actually means that invalid block with attestations that are not included on chain in a later slot or not coming from gossip can cause a split between implementations. This is unlikely to result in any issue in the network but obviously can affect test results

author: potuz
content: I can double check in a couple of hours but I think we send the attestations for processing after executing state transition
